conversations.content: Y'know, I feel like most living things instinctively relax when they're snuggled up in a small, cozy space.
Animals and insects don't just wander about under the hot sun. They like to sneak around in the dark and go out under the cover of night.
Y'know how the Pallid Imp said: ＂We're creatures of darkness, and the sun's our mortal enemy＂? Well, the same goes for me.
Besides, if I stay away from other people, I won't catch diseases or anything, and I also won't have to worry about war. It's perfect.
...Huh? That sounds like the lonely life of a shut-in? Aw, don't worry about me. I may be alone, but I'm not LONELY.
Heck, I have plenty of friends. Like the slimes!
See, a long time ago, I used to be pretty good friends with the slimes. They were my neighbors in the ruins.
Ever heard of 'em? They're all squishy and they hide in pots and don't ever leave—not even to eat or use the bathroom. They're the world's most hardcore shut-ins.
I always thought living in a pot sounded awesome, so I asked the slimes to teach me. And let me tell you, it was GRUELING.
You have to wriggle your body around just right to fit. Then you gotta jump to get anywhere, but you can't see where you're going. It makes you really dizzy!
So yeah, it was tough—but after months of training from dusk 'til dawn, I finally mastered the art of pot-living. Just like a slime!
But humans have this misconception that any pot they find in the middle of nowhere must have a slime in it— and also that slimes are an enemy.
And let me tell you, I got SO fed up dealing with round-the-clock, unprovoked attacks when I was living in my pot!
Eventually I gave up and just became a regular ol' shut-in. Still makes me sad to think about...
Y'know, Euden, you should try shutting yourself up in your room after a long day of fighting. It's VERY relaxing.
